abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sichuan Urban
            Environment Project in China were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: a practical approach to balance
            the Bank's priority for institutional development with
            the Government's priority for expanding wastewater
            coverage and service levels is necessary. As investment
            financing becomes less important to China, the Bank's
            future focus should shift to value addition, through
            programs to transfer knowledge of management systems and
            procedures. The objectives and priorities of Sichuan
            Province (SP) were different from those of the Bank. SP gave
            priority to honoring the agreements made with the central
            government to expand municipal wastewater treatment to
            reduce pollution discharges to the river system. An
            experienced Project Management Office staffed with a
            full-time Director and qualified technical staff, and
            supported by an experienced project management consultants
            are important ingredients for smooth project implementation.

            URBAN ENVIRONMENT PROJECTS,TF033696-CHINA - ENVIRONMENT, SHANDONG PROJECT,TF031077-CHINA - SICHUAN URBAN ENVIRONMENT,TF040226-CHINA - SUPERVISION AND
            PREPARATION:  SUEP, CUEP, SHANGHAI ENV., SHANGH,TF037731-CHINA - SICHUAN URBAN
            ENVIRONMENT PROJECT
5081652.majtheme: Urban development,Environment and natural resource management

abstracts.cdata!:
The Sichuan Urban Environment Project
            aims to provide a safe environmental setting for the
            sustainable long-term economic growth of urban areas in
            Sichuan Province, China. The project implements the first
            phase of an urban environmental services improvement program
            to recover from degradation of water and land resources,
            provide an adequate supply of safe water to its growing
            urban population and economy, and maintain water quality of
            the Yangtze River while protecting health, especially of
            lower income groups. The project consists of a comprehensive
            package of investments for five cities and comprises the
            following subcomponents: 1) water supply and wastewater
            systems development consisting of intercepting and linked
            sewers, outfalls from the sewers, secondary sewage
            construction, raw water transmission to treatment plants,
            treated water pumping stations, and distribution network
            improvements; 2) solid waste management consisting of
            funding operating equipment, and expanding and improving the
            existing landfills; 3) urban management information systems
            entailing creating new infrastructure, increasing
            operational efficiencies in existing infrastructure, and
            improving budgeting monitoring and management; 4)
            environmental protection including rehabilitating and
            improving access to cultural heritage sites, providing
            equipment for environmental monitoring, promotion, display,
            and adaptation of museums and historic sites; and 5)
            institutional strengthening and training.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Sichuan Urban Environment Project
            (SUEP) plans to enable sustainable environmental growth in
            Sichuan province through water supply improvement, water
            pollution control, and solid waste services for five cities
            in Sichuan (Chengdu, Leshan, Deyang, Zigong, and Luzhou).
            The resettlement action plan deals with all of the cities,
            noting that the number and type of population affected
            varies, from a single household (Leshan water supply site)
            to 340 (Chengdu), and comprised of both farmers and
            shopkeepers. Mitigation measures ensured by the Land Bureau
            include: a) proper arrangements for the relocation of
            residents as well as for finding them jobs with similar
            levels of skill and pay; b) minimum destruction of buildings
            while avoiding delays in construction to minimize land left
            idle; c) dissemination of resettlement information among
            affected populations and propaganda to encourage project
            support; d) within the limits of resettlement policies,
            requirements of relocated people are met as far as possible;
            e) support is given for relocatees to build houses in new
            areas with building materials provided at a preferential
            prices; and f) no delay in compensation payments.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Sichuan Urban Environment Project -
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This study reviews the environmental
            assessment of the Sichuan Urban Environment Project's
            impact on the Min and Tuo river basins area, its urban
            areas, as well as a small portion of the Yangtze river, in
            the proximity of Luzhou. Extreme pressures on the surface
            waters caused by a significant urbanization and
            industrialization in the region, call for an assessment of
            wastewater discharges control. Issues on industrial
            wastewater, agricultural water usage, water quality impacts,
            and pollution control, will be revisited further in later
            phases of the project. Even though the project is well
            formulated and meets sustainable prospects, with potential
            environmental benefits, it does allow for mitigation
            measures in pollution control, wastewater management, water
            discharges, and agricultural water pollution. Mitigation
            measures include: 1) management and operations training for
            staff in the utility companies in a wide range of
            disciplines; and, 2) monitoring the technical assistance
            program, providing both equipment and training for cities
            and provincial areas. Regarding the social impacts, where
            resettlement and compensation issues are envisaged, will be
            covered separately in the Resettlement Action Plan (RAP).

China - Sichuan Urban Environment Project -
            environmental assessment
